alert.note: Alert for Delaware (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 2:46PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL DELAWARE AND NORTHERN LICKING COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM EDT... At 245 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Sunbury, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Delaware, Sunbury, Utica, Ashley, Galena, Hartford, St. Louisville, Interstate 71 at US Route 36/State Route 37, Alum Creek State Park, Delaware State Park, US Route 62 at State Route 661, Olive Green, Stratford, Purity, Fallsburg, Leonardsburg, State Route 229 at US Route 23 and Kilbourne. This includes I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 127 and 138. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
